person.persName: John Flavel Fisk (Covington attorney and politician)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Genesee County, New York, native. Son of David Fisk and Abigail Sargeant. Attended Freeman Carey Institute in Hamilton County, Ohio, and the Law School of Covington in Covington, Kentucky. Married to Elizabeth S. Johnson on October 14, 1842. Father of Charles Fisk, Virginia Fisk, Clara Fisk, Robert Fisk, Isabella Fisk, John Fisk, and Elizabeth Fisk. Teacher in Germantown Academy in Mason County, Kentucky from 1840 to 1841. Principal of Maysville Academy from 1842 to 1847. Admitted to the bar in 1848. Member and president of the Covington School Board. Covington city attorney. County attorney for Kenton County. Member of the Kentucky state Senate from 1857 to 1865. Speaker of the Senate and ex-officio lieutenant governor in 1862 and 1863.
